job.title: Software Engineer - Junior Level
job.description: Purpose of Job<br><br>We are currently seeking a talented Software Engineer - Junior Level for our Plano, TX or 100% remote environment work location(s).<br><br>Provides support to the Enterprise and has an opportunity to significantly impact organizational growth and effectiveness through delivering best in class technology solutions. Engaged in all phases of the software systems and application development lifecycle which include; gathering and analyzing requirements, designing, testing, documenting and implementing software, responding to outages. Identify and manage existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and ensure these risks are effectively identified and escalated to be measured, monitored and controlled.<br><br>The selected candidate will join the Risk and Compliance team and will work on a multi-user high availability environment supporting one of the critical Risk Management Applications (Metricstream). They will also have opportunities to learn and support other technologies such as ServiceNow and Salesforce.<br><br>Job Requirements<br><br><strong><u>About Usaa<br><br></u></strong>USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.<br><br>USAA Information Technology: A Realistic Preview<br><br>USAA Careers – World Class Benefits<br><br><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.</li><li>Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled. </li><li>Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.</li><li>Design, develop, code, and test technical solutions collaborating with senior engineers.</li><li>Participate in code/design reviews to ensure smooth daily operations and accurate planning.</li><li>May begin to help organize work to deliver features and solutions.</li><li>Resolves simple production issues with some assistance through troubleshooting applications independently.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in related field of study, OR Certification from an approved technical field of study, OR 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required.</li><li>2 years of software development experience specific to a discipline/technology.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-2 years of support engineering experience</li><li>1-2 years of experience of troubleshooting in a multi-user high availability environment</li><li>1-2 Years of experience in a professional environment</li><li>Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking</li><li>Experience working in a production support or development environment<br></li></ul>The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.<br><br><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $66,300 - $119,500 *(this does not include geographic differential it may be applied based on your work location). Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.<br><ul><li>Geographical Differential: Geographic pay differential is additional pay provided to eligible employees working in locations where market pay levels are above the national average.<br></li></ul>Shift Premium will be addressed on an individual-basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.<br><br><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals. Please visit <strong>USAA Total Rewards</strong> for more details.<br><br>Relocation assistance is <strong>not </strong><strong>available</strong> for this position.
